block.p: Eleanor Sarah Hamilton, a daughter of Margaret B. Howland of Marion, Mass., and Charles K. Hamilton of Mount Hermon, Mass., was married yesterday to Karl Erich Vinacco, a son of Ursula and Dominic C. Vinacco of Warwick, R.I. The Rev. Leon W. Schultz performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Evangelical Lutheran Church in Providence, R.I.
The couple, both 26, graduated from the University of Rhode Island.

Eleanor Sarah Hamilton, a daughter of Margaret B. Howland of Marion, Mass., and Charles K. Hamilton of Mount Hermon, Mass., was married yesterday to Karl Erich Vinacco, a son of Ursula and Dominic C. Vinacco of Warwick, R.I. The Rev. Leon W. Schultz performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Evangelical Lutheran Church in Providence, R.I.
The couple, both 26, graduated from the University of Rhode Island.

The bride is an administrator in the risk management department at Harvard University in Cambridge, Mass., where she is also studying for a master's degree in English and American literature. Her mother is the manager of public education and visitor services at the Harvard University Art Museums. The bride's father teaches English at the Northfield Mount Hermon School in Northfield, Mass.

The bridegroom is a development engineer at Vtech Engineering, a company in Acton, Mass., that specializes in prototype design and product development. His father retired as a contractor in Warwick, R.I.
